blurb: Beard the kangaroo in his den and try and recover those ashes
author: A. N. Hornby

blurb: England won five out of six series, including a 5-1 win in 1978-79, the only time they have won five Tests in Australia (though there have been three 4-1 series wins). Despite this the 1981 Ashes, in which Ian Botham inspired England to famously improbable victory at Headingley, is the most cherished series victory of the period

A run of unbroken Australian success unprecedented in Ashes history. They won eight successive series, and lost just seven of 43 Tests (all but one of those in dead rubbers when Australia had already secured the urn)

In 2005 England won the Ashes for the first time in 18 years, a raucously-received victory in a spellbinding series. Though the urn was lost at the first attempt with a 5-0 thrashing in 2006-07 they won the next three series in a row, a short spell of dominance ended by another whitewash in 2013-14
